title: Man shot near Boyertown
content:
DOUGLASS TWP., Pa. - A man has died following what appears to be an accidental shooting in Berks County, police said.
Officers were dispatched late Tuesday morning to the first block of Chapel Lane in Douglass Township, just west of Boyertown.
Police told 69 News that a man, identified as Timothy Van Evera, 61, suffered a single gunshot wound to his chest.
A medical helicopter was initially requested to fly the victim to the trauma center at Reading Hospital, but paramedics ended up transporting him by ambulance to Pottstown Hospital, where he later died, police said.
An autopsy is set for Wednesday, with the cause and manner of death still under investigation.
